text: Psalm 37
The Protection of the Righteous and the Destruction of the Wicked
Of David.\f + \fr Ps 37 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
Do not fret because of evildoers;
do not be envious of doers of wickedness.
For like the grass they will dry up quickly,
and like green vegetation they will wither.
Trust Yahweh and do good.
Abide \add in the\add* land and feed on faithfulness.\f + \fr 37:3 \ft That is, God’s faithfulness \f*
Take pleasure in Yahweh as well,
and he will give to you the requests of your heart.
⸤Commit to⸥\f + \fr 37:5 \ft Literally “Roll upon” \f* Yahweh your way;
Trust also on him and he will act.
Then he will bring forth your righteousness like the light,
and your justice like the noonday.
Be quiet before Yahweh and wait for him.
Do not fret about one who succeeds \add in\add* his way,
about a man making plots.
Refrain from anger and forsake wrath.
Do not fret; \add it\add* only brings evil.
For evildoers will be cut off,
but those who wait for Yahweh—
they will possess \add the\add* land.
And\f + \fr 37:10 \ft Or “But” \f* yet a little \add while\add* and the wicked will not be,
and you will look carefully upon his place, but he will not be.
But \add the\add* afflicted will possess \add the\add* land,
and they will take pleasure in an abundance of peace.
\add The\add* wicked plans \add evil\add* against the righteous,
and gnashes at him \add with\add* his teeth.
\add The\add* Lord laughs at him,
for he sees that his day is coming.
\add The\add* wicked have drawn \add the\add* sword and have bent their bow
to throw down \add the\add* poor and \add the\add* needy,
to kill \add those\add* upright in \add their\add* way.
Their sword will enter into their \add own\add* heart,
and their bows shall be broken.
\add The\add* little belonging to the righteous \add is\add* better
than \add the\add* wealth of many wicked.
For \add the\add* arms of \add the\add* wicked shall be broken,
but Yahweh supports \add the\add* righteous.
Yahweh knows \add the\add* days of \add the\add* blameless,
and their inheritance will be forever.
They will not be put to shame in distressing times,\f + \fr 37:19 \ft Hebrew “time” \f*
and in \add the\add* days of famine they will be satisfied.
But \add the\add* wicked will perish,
and the enemies of Yahweh \add will be\add* like \add the\add* splendor of \add the\add* pastures.
They vanish; in smoke they vanish.
\add The\add* wicked borrows and does not repay,
but \add the\add* righteous \add is\add* gracious and gives.
For those blessed \add by\add* him shall possess \add the\add* land,
but those cursed \add by\add* him shall be cut off.
\add The\add* steps of a man are established by Yahweh,
and he takes pleasure in his way.
Though he fall, he will not be cast headlong,
for Yahweh supports \add him with\add* his hand.
I was a youth, but I am \add now\add* old;
yet I have not seen \add the\add* righteous forsaken
or his children ⸤begging for⸥\f + \fr 37:25 \ft Literally “searching” \f* bread.
All the day he \add is\add* gracious and lends,
and his children \add are\add* a blessing.
Turn aside from evil and do good
and \add so\add* abide forever.
For Yahweh loves justice
and will not forsake his faithful ones.
They are protected forever.
But \add the\add* children of \add the\add* wicked will be cut off.
\add The\add* righteous will possess \add the\add* land
and abide in it forever.
\add The\add* mouth of \add the\add* righteous utters wisdom,
and his tongue speaks justice.
The law of his God \add is\add* in his heart.
His steps will not slip.
\add The\add* wicked watches for the righteous
and seeks to kill him.
Yahweh will not abandon him into his hand,
and he will not let him be condemned when he is judged.
Wait for Yahweh and keep his way,
and he will exalt you to possess \add the\add* land.
When \add the\add* wicked are cut off, you will see \add it\add*.
I have seen \add the\add* wicked acting violently
and spreading himself out
like a luxuriant native tree.
Then he passed on\f + \fr 37:36 \ft Dead Sea Scrolls and the versions read “I passed by” \f* and behold, he was not.
And I sought him, but he could not be found.
Observe \add the\add* blameless and look at \add the\add* upright,
for \add there is\add* a future for a man of peace.
But transgressors shall be destroyed altogether.
\add The\add* future of \add the\add* wicked shall be cut off.
And\f + \fr 37:39 \ft Some manuscripts omit “and,” preserving the acrostic \f* \add the\add* salvation of \add the\add* righteous \add is\add* from Yahweh,
their refuge in \add the\add* time of trouble.
And Yahweh helps them and he rescues them.
He rescues them from \add the\add* wicked and saves them,
because they take refuge in him.
